knimeNode.name: Loop End (Upto 4 ports)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Loop end node to handle upto 4 input ports

fullDescription.intro:
Node at the end of a loop. It is used to mark the end of a workflow loop and collects the intermediate results by row-wise concatenation of the incoming tables. The start of the loop is defined by the loop start node, in which you can define how often the loop should be executed (either fixed or derived from data, e.g. the "group loop start"). All nodes in between are executed that many times. Inputs are optional, and the behaviour of output ports corresponding to non-connected inputs can be selected by the user.
This node was developed by Vernalis Research . For feedback and more information, please contact
knime@vernalis.com
fullDescription.option: Adds a column to each output table containing the iteration number, starting with 0
If set, ensure row IDs are unique by suffixing incoming row IDs with '_Iter#' followed by the iteration number

option.name: Ignore empty input tables at port ...

fullDescription.option: Selecting this option means the structure of empty input tables at the specified port will be ignored and they will not cause the node to fail

option.name: Return inactive branches for disconnected optional ports

fullDescription.option: If selected, optional input ports which are disconnected will have inactive branches as output ports. Otherwise, an empty, columnless table will result
